title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Harriet Brown to Frederick S. Tukey, July 24, 1867
summary: Harriet Brown writes to Tukey (although the Agent in Staunton by this time was Thomas P. Jackson) to report that a man who had been keeping her as his wife had deserted her. She asks how she should proceed.
keywords: Family, Community Values/Local Behavior, Women, American Civil War
